alert.note: Alert for Greater Portland Metro Area; Western Columbia River Gorge (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 22 at 3:54AM PST until February 23 at 12:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO NOON PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills 5 to 15 degrees. * WHERE...In Oregon, Greater Portland Metro Area and Western Columbia River Gorge. In Washington, Greater Vancouver Area and Western Columbia River Gorge. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to noon PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...A Wind Chill Advisory means that very cold air and strong winds will combine to generate low wind chills. This will result in frost bite and lead to hypothermia if precautions are not taken. If you must venture outdoors, make sure you wear a hat and gloves. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Coldest temperatures with possible single digit wind chills expected early Thursday morning between 2 AM and 8 AM.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.

area.areaDesc: Greater Portland Metro Area; Western Columbia River Gorge
